Description: A chronic condition where the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.
A metabolic disorder characterized by high blood glucose due to insulin resistance or deficiency.
A condition caused by narrowed heart arteries leading to reduced blood flow to the heart.
A group of progressive lung diseases that obstruct airflow and make breathing difficult.
A malignant tumor that originates from breast cells.
A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus.
A condition where the soft center of a spinal disc in the lower back pushes through a crack in the tougher exterior.
A chronic respiratory condition marked by airway inflammation and narrowing, causing breathing difficulty.
A progressive neurological disorder that leads to memory loss and cognitive decline.
A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints, causing inflammation and pain.
A long-term condition where the kidneys gradually lose function.
A condition involving sores or ulcers in the lining of the stomach or duodenum.
A condition in which the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells due to insufficient iron.
A neurological condition characterized by intense, recurring headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light or sound.
